member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSADDVPFLAGS3
member.summary: Determines whether to add a new virtual project to the Project window.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSADDVPFLAGS3.ADDVP_InvisibleInternalProject
member.summary: An invisible project that never interferes with the user adding a project of the same name. Normally any newly-added project has to have a unique name that does not clash with existing projects. ADDVP_InvisibleInternalProject projects are Virtual Projects that are either placeholder projects that listen for SolutionEvents (e.g. OnBeforeProjectRegisteredInRunningDocumentTable or OnAfterOpenProject) and auto-remove themselves so that they don’t interfere with the user-added project, or they are non-traditional internal (e.g. files imported by projects only like MSBuild targets files, Shared.projitems files or VC .filters files) that are never opened as normal projects directly. NOTE: ADDVP_InvisibleInternalProject includes the following flags:ADDVP_ExcludeFromBuild | ADDVP_ExcludeFromDeploy | ADDVP_ExcludeFromDebugLaunch | ADDVP_ExcludeFromEnumOutputs | ADDVP_ExcludeFromCfgUI and is not expected to be used in combination with ADDVP_AddToProjectWindow flag.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSDBGLAUNCHFLAGS140
member.summary: Flags that control the way the debugger is started.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSDBGLAUNCHFLAGS140.DBGLAUNCH_ContainsStartupTask
member.summary: Use Startup Task activator (currently used only for DLO_AppPackageDebug).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSFPROPID7
member.summary: Specifies property identifiers for window frames, document frames, and tool window frames.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHIERARCHYIMAGEASPECT
member.summary: Describes icons used for the hierarchy.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHIERARCHYIMAGEASPECT.HIA_Icon
member.summary: The icon for the hierarchy's normal state (may correspond to icons from VSHPROPID_IconMoniker, VSHPROPID_IconIndex, VSHPROPID_IconHandle, or a system image).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHIERARCHYIMAGEASPECT.HIA_OpenFolderIcon
member.summary: The icon for the hierarchy's expanded state (may correspond to icons from VSHPROPID_OpenFolderIconMoniker, VSHPROPID_OpenFolderIconIndex, VSHPROPID_OpenFolderIconHandle, or a system image).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHIERARCHYIMAGEASPECT.HIA_OverlayIcon
member.summary: The overlay icon for the hierarchy (may correspond to icons from VSHPROPID_OverlayIconIndex).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHIERARCHYIMAGEASPECT.HIA_StateIcon
member.summary: The state icon for the hierarchy (may correspond to icons from VSHPROPID_StateIconIndex).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8
member.summary: VT_BOOL [optional]. Determines whether or not the hierarchy supports icon monikers as an override of the VSHPROPID_IconImgList and VSHPROPID_IconHandle properties. Aggregatable projects should only support this property if they're the outermost aggregate, even if they do support ImageMoniker-based images.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_DiagHubLanguage
member.summary: BSTR [optional, required if VSHPROPID_DiagHubPlatform is provided]. Provides the language the project is targeting. Examples are 'CSharp', 'FSharp', 'VisualBasic', 'Cpp', 'CppCli', 'JavaScript', 'TypeScript'.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_DiagHubPlatform
member.summary: BSTR [optional]. Provides the Target Platform for the project type to the Diagnostics Hub.This is similar to VSHPROPID_TargetPlatformIdentifier but is Diagnostics Hub-specific. Examples are 'Windows', 'Windows_Phone', 'XBox', 'iOS', 'Android'.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_DiagHubPlatformVersion
member.summary: BSTR [optional, required if VSHPROPID_DiagHubPlatform is provided]. Provides the version of the target platform. This is similar to VSHPROPID_TargetPlatformVersion but is Diagnostics Hub-specific. This will be parsed as a .NET System.Version and should conform to its requirements.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_DiagHubProjectTarget
member.summary: BSTR [optional, required if VSHPROPID_DiagHubPlatform is provided]. Provides the GUID for the project target within the specified VSHPROPID_DiagHubProjectTargetFactory.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_DiagHubProjectTargetFactory
member.summary: BSTR [optional, required if VSHPROPID_DiagHubPlatform is provided]. Provides the GUID for the target factory within the Diagnostics Hub to use. The default value is '283ff32f-bc50-467c-a318-ee7015338ac0'.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_IconMonikerGuid
member.summary: GUID [optional]. Gets the Guid for an ImageMoniker associated with the item's icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_IconMonikerId
member.summary: VT_I4 [optional] Gets the Id for an ImageMoniker associated with the item's icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_IconMonikerImageList
member.summary: VT_UNKNOWN [optional]. Gets the IVsImageMonikerImageList, which can be used to query for ImageMonikers for this item.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_OpenFolderIconMonikerGuid
member.summary: GUID [optional]. Gets the Guid for an ImageMoniker associated with the item's expanded icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_OpenFolderIconMonikerId
member.summary: VT_I4 [optional]. Gets the Id for an ImageMoniker associated with the item's expanded icon.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_SharedProjectReference
member.summary: VT_UNKNOWN [optional]. Returns an IVsSharedProjectReference object for a particular shared project reference item node.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSHPROPID8.VSHPROPID_SupportsIconMonikers
member.summary: VT_BOOL [optional]. Determines whether or not the hierarchy supports icon monikers as an override of the VSHPROPID_IconImgList and VSHPROPID_IconHandle properties. Aggregatable projects should only support this property if they're the outermost aggregate, even if they do support ImageMoniker-based images.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSREFERENCEAPPLYRESULT
member.summary: Specifies the result of applying reference changes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSREFERENCEAPPLYRESULT.APPLYRESULT_AppliedSuccessfully
member.summary: The reference changes were applied successfully.

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSREFERENCEAPPLYRESULT.APPLYRESULT_NotApplied
member.summary: The reference changes were NOT applied successfully, but the Reference Manager Dialog may stay open (e.g. operation was canceled and project was not reloaded).

member.name: F:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.__VSREFERENCEAPPLYRESULT.APPLYRESULT_NotAppliedAndCloseDialog
member.summary: The reference changes were NOT applied successfully, and the Reference Manager Dialog must close (e.g. the project was reloaded and state of project is unknown).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IAsyncLoadablePackageInitialize
member.summary: Provides a way get access to IAsyncServiceProvider and IProfferAsyncService without needing to use IServiceProvider. Implemented by packages.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IAsyncProgressCallback
member.summary: Provides a way for asynchronous service and package owners to report progress. The reported progress can be shown to user in an appropiate manner by the shell. The interface is implemented by Visual Studio IDE. For package loads, the instance is passed to package via Initialize method. For services, package can retrieve the instance through IProfferAsyncService.GetServiceProgressCallback method. This interface is used for reporting progress for both package and service loads. For packages guidService argument is not used and will be ignored.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IAsyncProgressCallback.ReportProgress(System.Guid@,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reports progress.
member.param: The GUID of the service.
The message used to tell users to wait.
The message used to report progress.
The number of the current step.
The number of overall steps.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolExpressionEvaluator2
member.summary: Provides expression parsing and evaluation against a hit tester of boolean symbols in order to test whether a set of symbols cause the expression to evaluate to true. It is obtained by co-creating the BooleanSymbolExpressionEvaluator service GUID.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolExpressionEvaluator2.EvaluateExpression(System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolPresenceChecker)
member.summary: Evaluates the expression.
member.returns: True if contains the symbol(s) in , otherwise false.
member.param: The expression. For examples, P1 & P2 & (!P3 | P4). Null and empty strings are allowed; in that case the method returns true.
The object to check for presence of symbols encountered while parsing the expression. May NOT be null.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolPresenceBulkChecker
member.summary: Provides a bulk hit tester of boolean symbols used by IVsBooleanSymbolExpressionEvaluator2 when evaluating a boolean expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolPresenceBulkChecker.AreSymbolsPresent(System.Array)
member.summary: Checks for the presence of a collection of symbols.
member.returns: An array of equal length to symbols, where each element is set to true iff present.
member.param: An array of symbols (BSTR) to check for.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolPresenceBulkChecker.HasChangedSince(System.Object@)
member.summary: Determines whether the symbols defined may have changed since the last time this method was called. Implementations that do not track versions may return true.
member.returns: True if the results may have changed since the last call to this method, otherwise false.
member.param: The response version object assigned at the last call. May be null to get the initial version. At the conclusion of this method call, the object or pointer may be changed so that on a subsequent call we know what version was last observed. The caller should treat this value as an opaque object and should not assume any significance from whether the object pointer changed value or not.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolPresenceBulkChecker.IsSymbolPresent(System.String)
member.summary: Checks for the presence of a given symbol.
member.returns: True if the symbol is defined; false otherwise.
member.param: The symbol to check for

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolPresenceChecker
member.summary: Provides a hit tester of boolean symbols used by IVsBooleanSymbolExpressionEvaluator2 when evaluating a boolean expression.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolPresenceChecker.HasChangedSince(System.Object@)
member.summary: Determines whether the symbols defined may have changed since the last time this method was called. Implementations that do not track versions may return true.
member.returns: True if the results may have changed since the last call to this method, otherwise false.
member.param: The response version object assigned at the last call. May be null to get the initial version. At the conclusion of this method call, the object or pointer may be changed so that on a subsequent call we know what version was last observed. The caller should treat this value as an opaque object and should not assume any significance from whether the object pointer changed value or not.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsBooleanSymbolPresenceChecker.IsSymbolPresent(System.String)
member.summary: Checks for the presence of a given symbol.
member.returns: True if the symbol is defined; false otherwise.
member.param: The symbol to check for

member.summary: Creates a new custom ImageMoniker composed of multiple images rendered together
member.returns: The IImageHandle representing the composited image. The composited image can be removed using RemoveCustomImage.
member.param: The virtual width of the canvas the composite image is rendered on. Real pixel sizes are determined by the ImageAttributes used to load the image.
The virtual height of the canvas the composite image is rendered on. Real pixel sizes are determined by the ImageAttributes used to load the image.
The number of layers in the image.
The collection of layers composed into the image. Layers are stacked bottom-up (subsequent layers in the array are rendered on top of previous layers).

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsImageService2.ThemeDIBits(System.Int32,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Applies theming to BGRA32 device-independent bitmap bits. The luminosity of the image is transformed so that the constant "halo" luminosity blends in with the background. This has the effect of eliminating the halo visually. The "halo" luminosity is an immutable constant, and is not calculated from the input image. Images which contain cyan (#00FFFF) in their top-right pixel are not inverted. Instead, the top-right pixel is cleared (RGBA are all set to 0) and S_OK is returned without otherwise modifying the image.This method is a replacement for IVsUIShell5.ThemeDIBits.
member.returns: True if the pixels were themed, otherwise false.
member.param: The number of pixels in the pixel array.
The pixel array.
The width of the image, in pixels.
The height of the image, in pixels.
True if the bitmap is a top-down bitmap, otherwise false.
The background color.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsImageService2.TryAssociateNameWithMoniker(System.String,Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.Interop.ImageMoniker)
member.summary: Creates an association between an image name (from IVsImageService.Add and IVsImageService.Get) and an ImageMoniker (from IVsImageService.GetImage).
member.returns: True if the moniker was successfully associated with the name, false if some other moniker is already registered.
member.param: The image name.
The image moniker.

member.summary: Gets or sets the target platform version, which indicates to the user where the references come from.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsPlatformReferenceProviderContext2.VisualStudioVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the supported Visual Studio version. Software development kits (SDKs) with a higher Visual Studio version are filtered out.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsReferenceManagerUserReloadRequired
member.summary: Provides a method that is called once when it is actually time to apply any changes that require re loading of the project to make the updates.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsReferenceManagerUserReloadRequired.ApplyReloadRequiredReferenceChanges(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reference Manager calls this method once when it is actually time to apply any changes that require re loading of the project to make the updates. Projects that have reference changes that require reloading the project can add them to a queue when IVsReferenceManagerUser.ChangeReferences is called rather than applying them immediately and forcing possibly multiple project reloads. After all changes from all referenceProviderContexts have been propagated, then the ReferenceManager dialog will make a single call to ApplyReloadRequiredReferenceChanges. The Expected behavior is to apply all possible changes that were queued up by prior calls to IVsReferenceManagerUser.ChangeReferences and return a single error through HRESULT+IErrorInfo mechanism. If the reference changes are being aborted for any reason, then ApplyReloadRequiredReferenceChanges(cancelOperation:true) will be called to give the project a chance to clean up any state it has queued.
member.param: True if the operation was canceled, otherwise false.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSccGlyphs2

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSharedProjectReference
member.summary: Represents a SharedProjectReference item (normally a child of the References folder in the Solution Explorer). SharedProjectReference items represent imported shared MSBuild project files (e.g. *.projitems file). Normally these shared MSBuild project files are "owned" by a particular Shared Project (aka Shared Assets Project) loaded in the Solution.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSharedProjectReference.AlreadyReferenced
member.summary: Determines whether the project was already referenced.
member.returns: True if the project was already referenced, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSharedProjectReference.FullPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the full path of Shared Project's project file (e.g. *.shproj file).
member.returns: the full path of Shared Project's project file (e.g. *.shproj file).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSharedProjectReference.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name/caption of the Shared Project (owner project for the imported shared MSBuild file).
member.returns: The name/caption of the Shared Project (owner project for the imported shared MSBuild file).

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSharedProjectReference.SharedMSBuildFileFullPath
member.summary: Gets or sets the full path of the imported shared MSBuild file (e.g. *.projitems file).
member.returns: The full path of the imported shared MSBuild file (e.g. *.projitems file).

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSharedProjectReferencesHelper
member.summary: This is a helper service for projects that support adding/removing SharedProject References via the ReferenceManager dialog.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSharedProjectReferencesHelper.ChangeSharedMSBuildFileImports(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy,System.Array,System.Array,System.String)
member.summary: Changes the set of Shared MSBuild files imported by a project.
member.returns: True if the project has been reloaded, false if not.
member.param: The project that is being modified.
A list of MSBuild project file full paths (e.g. *.projitems) that should be removed from being imported.
A list of MSBuild project file full paths (e.g. *.projitems) that should be added as imports.
The label used to identify the MSBuild import statements of interest (e.g. Shared Project References use import statements with the label = "Shared").

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsSharedProjectReferencesHelper.ChangeSharedProjectReferences(Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsHierarchy,System.Int32,System.Object[],System.Int32,System.Object[])
member.summary: Changes the set of Shared Projects referenced by a project.
member.returns: True if project has been reloaded, false if not.
member.param: The project that is using the AddReferenceManager dialog to add SharedProject references.
The numberof SharedProject References to be removed.

An array of SharedProject references to be removed. Each element of the array is expected to support IVsSharedProjectReference or IVsHierarchy interface.May be null if there are no references to be removed.
The number of SharedProject References to be added.

An array of SharedProject references to be added. Each element of the array is expected to support IVsSharedProjectReference or IVsHierarchy interface. May be null if there are no references to be added.

member.name: T:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsTask2
member.summary: Extends IVsTask to add support for task-specific messages that are shown in the Threaded Wait Dialog when the UI thread is blocked on a task. If a WaitMessage isn't specified, then a generic message (Waiting for a required operation to complete...) is used.

member.name: P:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsTask2.WaitMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the message that is displayed in the Threaded Wait Dialog when the UI thread calls GetResult or Wait and the task isn't complete. If no WaitMessage is supplied (either null or whitespace) a generic message will be used.

member.summary: Stops the wait dialog.
member.param: True if the operation was canceled, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsThreadedWaitDialog4.HasCanceled(System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines whether the dialog has been canceled.
member.param: True if the dialog was canceled, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsThreadedWaitDialog4.StartWaitDialog(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether StartWaitDialog(Ex) has actually started a dialog.If StartWaitDialog (or StartWaitDialogEx) is called multiple times without calling EndWaitDialog, only the first will start the dialog. Subsequent calls will just be no-ops. This makes it difficult to determine how often a call site caused the dialog to show. pfStarted will be set to true if the call to StartWaitDialogEx started the wait dialog (or started the timer to show the dialog).
member.param: The wait dialog caption
The wait message.
The progress text.
Optional. Should be a VT_INT_PTR containing a valid BMP, or VT_NULL.
The status bar text. Can be NULL.
The number of seconds to delay showing the dialog.
True if there is a cancelable button on the dialog, otherwise false.
Marquee-style progress will be shown with VARIANT_BOOL, otherwise no visible progress bar.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsThreadedWaitDialog4.StartWaitDialogEx(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether StartWaitDialog(Ex) has actually started a dialog.If StartWaitDialog (or StartWaitDialogEx) is called multiple times without calling EndWaitDialog, only the first will start the dialog. Subsequent calls will just be no-ops. This makes it difficult to determine how often a call site caused the dialog to show. pfStarted will be set to true if the call to StartWaitDialogEx started the wait dialog (or started the timer to show the dialog).
member.returns: True if the dialog was actually displayed, or false if it was already visible.
member.param: The wait dialog caption
The wait message.
The progress text.
Optional. Should be a VT_INT_PTR containing a valid BMP, or VT_NULL.
The status bar text. Can be NULL.
The number of seconds to delay showing the dialog.
True if there is a cancelable button on the dialog, otherwise false.
Marquee-style progress will be shown with VARIANT_BOOL, otherwise no visible progress bar.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsThreadedWaitDialog4.StartWaitDialogWithPercentageProgress(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Object,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.param: The wait dialog caption
The wait message.
The progress text.
Optional. Should be a VT_INT_PTR containing a valid BMP, or VT_NULL.
The text of the status bar.
True if there is a cancelable button on the dialog, otherwise false.
The number of seconds to delay showing the dialog.
The number of steps.
The index of the current step.

member.name: M:Microsoft.VisualStudio.Shell.Interop.IVsThreadedWaitDialog4.UpdateProgress(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Updates the progress of the wait dialog.
member.param: The text of the updated wait message.
The progress text.
The text of the status bar.
The index of the current step.
The number of steps.
True to disable cancellation, otherwise false.
True if canceled, otherwise false.
